note: no mandatory federal stay at home order, but PM asked Canadians on March 23 to stay at home (2nd link)
night curfew, schools closed, commercial business activity suspended

schools closed from March 15 ; a set of measures including a curfew is effective from  March 25 but no mandatory restriction on day activities is enforced, even if the government asks people to 'stay at home'
partial lockdown (in between social distanciations measures and a real lockdown) imposed in Jakarta, and then West Sumatra

non essential business closures, restriction of gatherings. schools closure timeline to be recontructed (first closure : https://en.radiofarda.com/a/iran-announces-closure-of-universities-schools-to-fight-coronavirus/30449711.html)
not a real lockdown : states of emergency were declared for 7 cities on April 8 and extended to the whole country on April 16 but they rely on incentives and not on mandatory orders
measures announced on March 15 ; the strategy of the governement is allegedly to build mass immunity

complex : nine different dates for nine cities. Synthesis taking into account only main cities lockdowns : Norman,  effective March 25 at 11:59 p.m. ;  Oklahoma City and Tulsa, both effective March 28 at 11:59 p.m. ; Edmond and Stillwater, both effective March 30 at 11:59 p.m.
no mandatory lockdown (first link), but a state of emergency was declared on March 17 and can be taken into account as change in social distances

a majority of regions (but not all of them) enforced confinment from March 24 ; an extension of a 'national lockdown' is mentioned in the second link, however we did not find a clear date for such a countrywide measure
not a national lockdown, only Luzon is placed under 'enhanced quarantine measures' but Luzon is by far the most populous area of Phlippines
schools closed form March 12; from March 25 : gatherings limited to 2 persons; from March 31 : restrictions tightened with public spaces and stores closed
state of emergency with social distanciation, no stay at home order
three waves of lockdowns : first Moscow, then progressively the rest of Russia
wide scale use of tests (one of the most effective in the world) ; no lockdown so far (first link), social distancing enforced from March 21
